Summarize a Variable

<<<<<<< HEAD Source: R/summarize_.R ======= >>>>>>> cf1e04cd1c7ac9a4ae0ffe3bb264178f3d9b9cd7
summarize_variables.Rd

Summarize a Variable

summarize_variables(
  data,
  incl_num_calc = TRUE,
  names_to = "Variable",
  values_to = "Value",
  grouper
)

Arguments

data

A dataframe or tibble.
incl_num_calc

If TRUE, includes an additional dataframe of summary statistics on the numeric columns in the dataframe.
names_to

Passed to `tidyr::pivot_longer()`.
values_to

Passed to `tidyr::pivot_longer()`.
grouper

(Optional) Group by column.

See also

pivot_longer reexports,group_by_all,vars,summarise_all,select

Other summary functions: observation_count()

Examples

library(tidyverse)
test_data <- 
        tibble(
                Group = sample(c("Apple", "Pear"), size = 10, replace = TRUE),
                A     = sample(c(NA_integer_, 1:3), size = 10, replace = TRUE),
                B     = sample(c(NA_integer_, 4:6), size = 10, replace = TRUE),
                C     = sample(c(NA_real_, seq(from = 6.01, to = 6.09, by = 0.01)), size = 10, replace = TRUE)
        )


summarize_variables(data = test_data,
                    incl_num_calc = FALSE)

#> # A tibble: 4 x 7
#>   Variable COUNT DISTINCT_COUNT NA_COUNT NA_STR_COUNT BLANK_COUNT
#>   <chr>    <int>          <int>    <int>        <int>       <int>
#> 1 A           10              4        4            0           0
#> 2 B           10              4        1            0           0
#> 3 C           10              6        0            0           0
#> 4 Group       10              2        0            0           0
#> # … with 1 more variable: DISTINCT_VALUES <chr>

summarize_variables(data = test_data,
                    incl_num_calc = TRUE)
